column4: does anyone know how to see if a button will been sent though acpi? I know there is a way, can't remember how though.
is there more to it? I am not getting anything.
after reading the manpage, you probably determined that you need to start the acpi daemon (acpid)
acpid is running. checked using ps - A | grep acpi
then the button is not being sent through acpi, try using "xev" and checking the output
i know xev is working because i can pick up some of the other buttons

in case you are wondering, or might have the answer, i am trying to get the button output form my DV5000 laptop. it has the quickplay buttons and i want to set them so they open music and DVD software, but i need the key code from them
what type of computer/laptop do you have?
it is ok, i sent it not too long ago.

Patrick is partly right, yes the dvd button is used to boot the system into an embed windows to play DVD's, but that is when the system is off. when it is on it would start the windows only quick play software. since i can't install quick play on linux, it should still be possible to use the buttons to run linux based systems
Ahadiel has mentioned that is DV6000 laptop (next model up) works fine with all the buttons and I have found key codes for the 6000 to set the DVD button.
let me know if it works
so far i have nothing. was hoping someone in here with a dv5000 might have the answer
